intro: Cyrtophyllum giganteum, commonly known as the giant cyrtophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant has a woody stem and produces palmate leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
